page.title: 04A Child's Life on the Farm
page.content: Katherine Ruth Woods (aged 7) has lived at Leys Farm for 3 years. She and her brother are two of the dozen children in this area. Her father Geoff is the stockman for the Barton Abbey Estate and her mother Sue is a part-time district nurse. She has to be taken to school by car as it is over a mile away, in Middle Barton. She will do reading, art work, number work, writing, PE and listen to a story at school, and she also has her dinner there. Her mother collects her at 3.00, and takes her home to watch her favourite TV programme or she goes to play with a friend, until tea at 5.30. She goes to bed at 7.00, or for a treat at 7.20 if her mother is listening to 'The Archers' on the radio!
